channel.title: PC Build
channel.description:
So my brother needs a new computer, so I'm going to put one together. I'm not a noob in this sector, but it's always good to hear other opinions. What do you think of the build for it's budget and What would you recommend changing and why? We need to stay in the budget of 750-800€, with the eye on being able to run games like fc3 on high graphics. Ultra isn't necessary, just enough to actually run newer and close future games.
[b]This is the build: (all prices in euro)[/b] power supply: [s]ZALMAN ZM360B-APS - 49,96[/s] Corsair Builder Series CX600 - 61,90 graphical card: Palit GeForce GTX 660 OC - 186,29 DVD/BR combo: LG CH10LS28 Super Multi Blue - 63,67 RAM: Kingston HyperX Genesis 2x4GB - 68,90 CPU: [s]Intel Core i5 3470 - 170,90[/s] Intel Core i5 3570K / 3.4 GHz - 4 Cores 199,90 CPU cooler: Cooler Master Hyper TX 3 Evo - 18,90 Motherboard: ASUS P8Z68-V PRO/GEN3 - 93,95 Case: Corsair Carbide Series 200R - 52,90 ---------------------------- = 746,53
edit: I just saw that the other build here on the GQ page has the same case, I guarantee that this is coincidence lol.

item.title: PC Build
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“RandQm, post:12, topic:526453”][quote author=Kidpaparoach link=topic=645196.msg4341347#msg4341347 date=1375211145]
does http://azerty.nl/ ship globally?

@ chill
i5’s perform similar as i7’s gaming wise but not when it comes to other tasks such as rendering I’ve heard. Either way for the op i5 would suit him best but i7’s are overall a lot better.
[/quote]
Nope, only Belgium and Netherlands.

Thanks for the feedback, updated my build. Would 600W look fine? The gfx-card uses 450W.
btw, I buy from azerty.nl, they sell with loss because they get big bonuses for the amounts they sell that compensates their loss.

@HcoJustin
About the TX650M, it isn’t really modular. It doesn’t support SLI. Also I don’t think the price/features ratio fits into my build

Didn’t know you were going to SLI, you couldn’t really run 2 cards on 650W anyways. I have the CX600 in my current build and I’m not a fan of having all the unused cables running through my case

No I’m not going to SLI, I was just saying because you said it was modular.[/quote]
cries

Read full topic

item.title: PC Build
item.dc:creator: @chillwitm888 chillwitm888
item.description:
@chillwitm888 wrote:

[quote=“Kidpaparoach, post:6, topic:526453”]I’m not a big hardware nerd unfortunately but,
I’d recommend:
Changing the processor out for the 3570k or getting a new 4th gen i5 if your budget can afford it, for gaming make sure it has the letter ‘k’ in it’s model as those ones are better for overclocking. Your processor is good enough but for the price margin your paying extra it’s worth upgrading.
Get the geforce 760 gfx card, it’s in the same region of pricing as the 660 and is the next generation card. It’s not meant for overclocking etc (I believe) but it has some serious power under the hood. I believe the overall performance is something like 10% better or more and I’m p sure it has a lot more vram (?) which is good for multiple monitors etc. And, of course the support will last for longer for a newer card :D.
I’d estimate that these upgrades would add around 100 euro’s onto the price however, the performance increase would vary from 10-25% (estimate 25 but around that mark) which is a very nice performance boost.[/quote]
Idk I haven’t looked but I heard, 770 is oc version if 680 for under 400$
And possibly 760 is oc 660 ti, idk. U can get 670 for 425$ 770 for under 400
760 for 260… Pretty good deal to me
Btw @ op
Euro is abt equal to pds?
Psu I would get silver stone or corsair because I think they are abit more reliable in my opinion however, I guess if ur settled stick with zalman
Get 3570k it outs performs most higher end i7s
It’s not that much more + more oc

Read full topic

item.title: PC Build
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“RandQm, post:4, topic:526453”][quote author=HcoJustin link=topic=645196.msg4340348#msg4340348 date=1375091844]
360W PSU with a 660 and i5? Ya right… You’re going to want something with more power, and a more reliable brand. The 660 alone recommends a minimum 450W supply.
[/quote]
Yeah I didn’t calculate my wattages yet, I don’t really know good brands either for power supply tbh.
I’m a bit in the dark with that one.[/quote]
Anything corsair will be fine, and for the love of god please get something modular. The TX650M is about 110 euro will be modular, and will be enough power for your current setup.

Read full topic

item.title: PC Build
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

I’m not a big hardware nerd unfortunately but,
I’d recommend:
Changing the processor out for the 3570k or getting a new 4th gen i5 if your budget can afford it, for gaming make sure it has the letter ‘k’ in it’s model as those ones are better for overclocking. Your processor is good enough but for the price margin your paying extra it’s worth upgrading.
Get the geforce 760 gfx card, it’s in the same region of pricing as the 660 and is the next generation card. It’s not meant for overclocking etc (I believe) but it has some serious power under the hood. I believe the overall performance is something like 10% better or more and I’m p sure it has a lot more vram (?) which is good for multiple monitors etc. And, of course the support will last for longer for a newer card :D.
I’d estimate that these upgrades would add around 100 euro’s onto the price however, the performance increase would vary from 10-25% (estimate 25 but around that mark) which is a very nice performance boost.

Read full topic

item.title: PC Build
item.dc:creator: @Java-RSPS-Noob Java-RSPS-Noob
item.description:
@Java-RSPS-Noob wrote:

[quote=“RandQm, post:4, topic:526453”][quote author=HcoJustin link=topic=645196.msg4340348#msg4340348 date=1375091844]
360W PSU with a 660 and i5? Ya right… You’re going to want something with more power, and a more reliable brand. The 660 alone recommends a minimum 450W supply.
[/quote]
Yeah I didn’t calculate my wattages yet, I don’t really know good brands either for power supply tbh.
I’m a bit in the dark with that one.

I get the feeling UK prices for parts is a hell a lot more expensive than America if 750 euro only gets you a 660 lol

You do realize euro is europe do you?[/quote]you should try to rebuild that set up on pcpartpicker website to get more information on what needs to be changed I would also make an account on there and post the setup you are looking at on their forums you can get some excellent advice from the members on there.

And yeah euro = euro money I mean.

Read full topic

item.title: PC Build
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

So my brother needs a new computer, so I’m going to put one together.
I’m not a noob in this sector, but it’s always good to hear other opinions.
What do you think of the build for it’s budget and What would you recommend changing and why?
We need to stay in the budget of 750-800€, with the eye on being able to run games like fc3 on high graphics.
Ultra isn’t necessary, just enough to actually run newer and close future games.

This is the build: (all prices in euro)
power supply: ZALMAN ZM360B-APS - 49,96 Corsair Builder Series CX600 - 61,90
graphical card: Palit GeForce GTX 660 OC - 186,29
DVD/BR combo: LG CH10LS28 Super Multi Blue - 63,67
RAM: Kingston HyperX Genesis 2x4GB - 68,90
CPU: Intel Core i5 3470 - 170,90 Intel Core i5 3570K / 3.4 GHz - 4 Cores 199,90
CPU cooler: Cooler Master Hyper TX 3 Evo - 18,90
Motherboard: ASUS P8Z68-V PRO/GEN3 - 93,95
Case: Corsair Carbide Series 200R - 52,90
---------------------------- = 746,53

edit: I just saw that the other build here on the GQ page has the same case, I guarantee that this is coincidence lol.
